node.title: Spirit Airlines Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Engine Catches Fire
node.alt: Spirit Airlines Airbus A319-132 takes off from Los Angeles international Airport on January 13, 2021 in Los Angeles, California. A Spirit Airlines flight flying from Minneapolisâ€“Saint Paul International Airport on Sunday night had to return and make an emergency landing before it completed its flight due to an engine fire.
node.description: The Spirit Airlines Airbus A320 took off at around 7.15 p.m. local time on Sunday, and had to make an emergency landing at 7.50 p.m.
node.content:
["A Spirit Airlines flight flying from Minneapolis\u2013Saint Paul International Airport to Orlando, Florida, on Sunday night had to return and make an emergency landing before it completed its flight, due to an apparent engine fire.", "The Twitter account of MN Crime, which monitors crime in Minnesota, said that Spirit flight NK135 was returning to the airport due to an engine fire.", "The Spirit Airlines Airbus A320 took off at around 7.15 p.m. local time on Sunday and was meant to land in Orlando at around 11.30 p.m. the same evening. But, the flight had to turn back after the engine caught alight and land back in Minneapolis at around 7.50 p.m.", "MN crime tweeted that Bloomington and Richfield Fire Department were responding to the incident.", "\"Aircraft has landed. Crash truck 16 reporting the fire appears to be out. The plane is stopping on the runway and will be investigated further by fire crews. Assisting fire departments can clear and go back in service,\" MN Crime added.", "\"Fire crews are not finding any heat on the engines with thermal imagers at this time. The aircraft is headed into the gate now.\"", "A social media video shows the aircraft landing safely on the runway before emergency crews investigate.", "The flight eventually departed with no issues at 10.55 p.m. local time and arrived in Orlando at 2.35 a.m. EST, according to FlightAware. No injuries were reported, according to Kare 11.", "There have been many emergency landings at Minneapolis\u2013Saint Paul International Airport over the years. Among the most notable includes one time when a passenger on a flight from New York's John F Kennedy International Airport to San Francisco International Airport in May was found snorting a white substance and refused to wear a face mask.", "According to a report by NBC, Mark Anthony Scerbo, 42-year-old man from Mechanicville, New York, was arrested on suspicion of drug possession, after been snorting the substance on JetBlue Flight 915 on May 16.", "A passenger on board recorded the incident on their phone and posted it online on their Twitter account.", "In the video, a flight attendant could be heard telling passengers that Scerbo was refusing to keep his mask on and was \"antagonizing\" other people on board the flight.", "The attendant said Scerbo was aggressive and gesturing a stabbing motion to another passenger, and was also seen \"snorting a white substance.\"", "In 2019, a Delta pilot was taken off a fully-boarded plane at Minneapolis-Saint Paul Airport and arrested on suspicion of being under the influence of alcohol.", "", "
Spirit Airlines Airbus A319-132 takes off from Los Angeles international Airport on January 13, 2021 in Los Angeles, California. A Spirit Airlines flight flying from Minneapolis\u2013Saint Paul International Airport on Sunday night had to return and make an emergency landing before it completed its flight due to an engine fire.
"]
